titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Richard C. Cornuelle papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Justyna K. Szulc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-03-09T15:08-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Incremental material placeholder series added and collection extent updated by Sarah Patton.

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, notes, printed matter, photographs, and videocassettes relating to libertarian social theory and to private philanthropy as a means of meeting social needs.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Richard C. Cornuelle papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2014.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collection(s)
relatedmaterial.p: Milton Friedman papers, Hoover Institution Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Charles Cornuelle was a well-known American libertarian thinker who is credited with coining the term “independent sector.” He is the author of a number of articles and books, among them his seminal work, Reclaiming the American Dream (1965).

chronitem.event: Born in Elwood, Indiana, the second son of Herbert Cumming Cornuelle and Gertrude Schleitzer Cornuelle.
Moved with his family to Hartford City, Indiana, where his father was pastor of the Hartford City Presbyterian Church.
Attended North Ward Elementary School in Hartford City, completing grades 1 through 3 there.
His father died of lobar pneumonia after a brief illness.
Drove to California with family to start a new life in Los Angeles.
Attended grades 4 to 6 at Aldema Elementary School in Highland Park, Los Angeles, California.
Attended grades 7 and 8 at Luther Burbank Junior High School in Highland Park.
Moved to Pasadena, California.
Attended grades 9 and 10 at McKinley Junior High School in Pasadena, California
Attended grades 11 and 12 to complete high school at Pasadena Junior College.
Enlisted in the United States Naval Reserve as an Apprentice Seaman. While in the Navy he attended Occidental College as a pre-med student.
Discharged from the Navy.
Graduated from Occidental College with a major in economics.
Attended New York University's Graduate School of Business Administration to study under Ludwig Von Mises. Worked for the National Industrial Conference Board.
Worked for the Foundation for Economic Education and the Small Business Economic Foundation in Evanston, Illinois.
Worked for the William Volker Fund in San Mateo, California.
Married Sydney Walton in San Francisco, California.
Daughter, Suzanne Cornuelle was born in San Francisco.
Moved to Princeton, New Jersey to work for the Princeton Panel.
Son, Peter Garrett was born in San Francisco.
Daughter, Jenny Cornuelle was born in San Francisco.
Returned to the William Volker Fund and worked with related organizations.
Book, Reclaiming the American Dream, was published.
Relocated to New York City as executive vice president of the National Association of Manufacturers.
Was separated from Sydney Cornuelle and later divorced.
Became a business consultant and full-time writer.
Book, De-Managing America, was published.
Book, Healing America,was published.
Married Elizabeth Kaplan Fonseca in New York.
Died

bioghist.p: As written by Richard Cornuelle (Source): Folder 1 and 5, Richard C. Cornuelle papers, 1915-2011, Box 1, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the personal and professional life of Richard Charles Cornuelle. Materials in the collection include biographical and genealogical documents, correspondence, and various projects with which Cornuelle was involved, mainly from the Earhart Foundation and the J. M. Kaplan Fund or as an independent contributor. The collection also includes research files on various topics of interest to Cornuelle, some of which include: business, education, the independent sector, labor and workforce, and violence in United States.

Additionally housed are speeches and writings of Cornuelle and other individuals. Cornuelle's writings include numerous articles, papers, an unpublished manuscript entitled "Garet Garrett’s Journal," as well as his published books: Reclaiming the American Dream (1965), De-Managing America: The Final Revolution (1975), and Healing America (1983). There are also articles written by Cornuelle that were featured in the Times Literary Supplement.

The symposiums and conferences section of the collection is comprised of files pertaining to events such as conferences, roundtables, and workshops attended by Cornuelle. The collection also contains a printed matter file, which includes various publications, journals, magazines, and annual reports collected by Cornuelle. Sound and video recordings include a compact sound cassette recording and various video recordings. Of special note is a VHS tape entitled “A Conversation with Richard Cornuelle,” created by the Liberty Fund, Intellectual Portrait Series.
When possible the original folder titles and arrangement established by Richard Cornuelle have been retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The biographical file documents the personal and family life of Richard Cornuelle and is composed of biographical and genealogical information on Cornuelle and some of his family members. Additional files concern hobbies and interests, school and family photos, certificates and diplomas, and school yearbooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of biographical outlines of family members, clippings, copies of photos that were used in the family scrapbook, correspondence,research done as part of a family genealogy project, writings, and sections of the family tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Composed of materials that reflect the extracurricular interests of Cornuelle. Includes information on museums, opera, and ballet, as well as walking/hiking and tennis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes pamphlets, performance programs, currency, notes, brochures, and a transparency of a Russian religious icon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of copies of yearbooks from schools attended by Cornuelle. File also includes a play bill from the Occidental College Glee Clubs Home Concert.

did.unittitle: Occidental College Glee Clubs: Home Concert,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Composed of correspondence between Richard Cornuelle and his friends, family, and associates. Materials have been filed by the last name; when the last name is unknown, materials are filed by the first name. The file titles are a repeat of original file titles created by Cornuelle. The correspondence is of both a personal and professional nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of materials related to various projects Cornuelle was involved in, supported, or recommended for funding. Though materials are mainly from the Earhart Foundation and the J. M. Kaplan Fund, other projects include: Cato Institute, Edison Project, Gateway to the Future, Liberty Fund, and Underwriters Laboratories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Composed of articles, clippings, correspondence, meeting minutes, documents regarding the history of the foundation, memoranda, notes, and an analysis paper entitled, “Where do we go from here? The Future of Free Societies: The first stage of analysis undertaken for the Earhart Foundation,” commissioned by the Earhart Foundation and written by Richard Cornuelle.

did.unittitle: "The Death and Resurrection of Community in America,"
"Where do we go from here? The Future of Free Societies: The first stage of analysis undertaken for the Earhart Foundation,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of various files concerning initiatives and grants funded by the J. M. Kaplan Fund. Some of the organizations that benefitted include: Critical Review Foundation, DonorsTrust, Manhattan Institute for Policy Research, and School of Advanced International Studies at Johns Hopkins.

did.unittitle: School of Advanced International Studies: Johns Hopkins,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Composed of research materials gathered by Cornuelle on topics which he was interested in actively writing about. The majority of research materials gathered pertain to business, education, the environment, the independent sector, labor and workforce, and violence in the United States. Additional topics include baby boomers, photographic reproductions from the Bettman Archives, Jonas Salk, and documents pertaining to the concept of philanthropic enterprise. Original order of documents has been retained

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes information on contract management, cost accounting, industry standards, and spontaneous order materials.

did.unittitle: Business Starts, Business Failures, Bankruptcy Cases - Number of National Nonprofit Associations,
Center for the Study of Market Processes,
Copies of The New York Times, articles,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes information on early education in the U.S., homeschooling, higher education, and intelligence testing.

did.unittitle: "Education Vouchers: A Report on Financing Elementary Education by Grants to Parents,"
"How Free Enterprise Is Solving the Problem of the Needy College Student,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a proposal from the Competitive Enterprise Institute and information regarding regulations for environmental management.

did.unittitle: A Proposal of the Competitive Enterprise Institute,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of files pertaining to the independent sector, the Heartland Institute, and USA Funds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes information on the history of labor in the United States, manufacturing, and the workforce demographic.

scopecontent.p: Comprised of documents pertaining to violence in the U.S. and two files regarding the Leo Frank case.

did.unittitle: "Big Trouble: Murder in a Small Western Town Sets Off a Struggle for the Soul of America,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Composed of speeches and writings of various individuals, including Richard Cornuelle.

did.unittitle: Bayles, Martha and McClay, Wilfred M.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of articles and papers written by Cornuelle. In addition, copies of his three books and various documents associated with their creation and publication are included. The series also includes Cornuelle’s unpublished manuscript, "Garet Garrett’s Journal," and the articles that he wrote for the Times Literary Supplement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of various printed materials: annuals reports, articles, brochures, newspaper clippings, journals, magazines, newsletters, and pamphlets.

scopecontent.p: Comprised of various magazines featuring Cornuelle's articles or mentioning his work.

scopecontent.p: Includes five VHS videocassettes and one compact sound cassette.
